Wow, really 21st-century stuff you got there. As a NeoVim user I find this "tutorial" pathetic. Now listen up, you antiquated Emacs peasants, because I'm gonna learn you good. First off, in NeoVim, I don't need 35 plugins and a sacrifice to the GNU gods to type "blimpy." Nah, man, I got that magic at my fingertips with minimal configuration. It's so easy, I don't even need a tutorial—unlike some people. By the time your Emacs even boots up, I've already typed "blimpy," wrote a Python script to automate my blimpy typing, and maybe even found time to pity the Emacs users of the world. NeoVim is like the sports car of text editors, while Emacs is... well, it's like a horse-drawn carriage. Historical, but not exactly a speed demon! It was a good try but NeoVim will always be superior text editor for your blimpy needs.
Oh I forgot I can't read Kanji.
